intro: Leucandra betonicifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf betony, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and spikes of small, blue-violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and long blooming period.
